ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Pure-tone thresholds are within normal limits (0-10 dB HL) bilaterally, with excellent speech recognition scores and normal tympanograms.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity across the frequency range given family concerns about hearing.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc, although testing was attempted.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation revealed normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with thresholds between 0 and 10 dB HL. Speech audiometry showed excellent word recognition (100%) and SRTs consistent with pure-tone averages. Tympanometry indicated normal middle ear function. Acoustic reflexes could not be measured due to technical difficulties with the probe seal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally (0-10 dB HL) at 250-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (Right: 10 dB HL, Left: 8 dB HL) in agreement with PTA. WRS 100% bilaterally at 55 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally (Static Admittance 0.70 mmho).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Could not test (CNT) due to inability to maintain a probe seal.

proposed_items: Return for hearing test as needed
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing test results are completely normal in both ears.
Discuss that difficulty hearing in the dance studio is likely due to background noise and acoustics.
Explain that the loud voice may be a habit or a natural reaction to the noisy environment (Lombard effect).

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is scheduled to follow up with the otologist; no audiologic pathology was identified.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing status if patient notices changes.
